Text.content:
Since OpenCms 9.5 content can be edited and added via a JavaScript API. We call this feature “User-generated content”, or 'UGC' for short. It allows

  • Users to generate/edit content without login
  • Adding/editing of content from the online project
  • The provision of completely customized ways to fill and edit content
  • The use of client-side validation of content that goes beyond the validation rules in XSDs
  • Building a back-end to an existing form that creates/alters OpenCms XML content

There is nearly no restriction on how you fill content or display content elements. Only with file uploads, are you tied to a form.This is necessary due to browser restrictions on file upload.

Using UGC, you can for example easily create:

  • A blog
  • A guest book
  • Any kind of forms
  • and more
